newsitem.title: INDIA: TEXT-Indian excise duty on cosmetics, toiletries.
newsitem.headline: TEXT-Indian excise duty on cosmetics, toiletries.

text.p: Following is the text of a statement issued by the Indian Finance Ministry on excise duties on cosmetics and toilet preparations.

"In the budget proposal for 1997/98, the finance minister had announced introduction of a scheme to levy excise duty on the basis of maximum retail price in respect of notified commodities. This scheme is contained in new section 4A which was inserted in the Central Excise Act 1994 by the Finance Act 1997.

Government has decided to apply the new scheme of charging excise duty on the basis of maximum retail price to cosmetics and toilet preparations falling under heading No 33.03, 33.04, 33.05 and 33.07 of the Central Excise Tariff. This scheme would come into force from 1st July, 1997. Accordingly, notification under section 4A has been issued by the Finance Ministry on 19.6.97.

With effect from 1st July, 1997, cosmetics and toilet preparations falling under the aforesaid headings of the Central Excise Tariff shall be chargeable to excise duty on the value calculated at 50 percent of the maximum retail price declared on such cosmetics and toilet preparations."
